fr.etienne_boespflug.adl

Class MessageBox

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.etienne_boespflug.adl.MessageBox

  • public class MessageBox
extends java.lang.Object
    The MessageBox class provides static method for generating standard AlertDialog.

    The information, warning, critical and question dialogs are availables.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  MessageBox.ResponseListener
      The ResponseListener interface defines the listener methods used to handle the result of a response AlertDialog.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private MessageBox()

    • Method Detail

      • information

        public static android.app.AlertDialog information(android.content.Context context,
                                                  java.lang.String title,
                                                  java.lang.String message,
                                                  java.lang.String positiveButtonText,
                                                  android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener onPositiveClickListener)
        Creates a new information AlertDialog with the specified message and title.

        A positive button is added to the dialog if the string positiveButtonText is not null. If onPositiveClickListener is not null, use this listener for the positive button, otherwise use a default listener which do nothing.

        Parameters:
        context - the parent context.
        title - the title of the dialog.
        message - the information message of the dialog.
        positiveButtonText - the text of the positive button if the string is non-null. Otherwise, no button is created.
        onPositiveClickListener - the listener of the positive button (if the dialog has a positive button) if non-null, use a default listener otherwise.
        Returns:
        the created information alert dialog.
        See Also:
        information(Context, String, String, String), information(Context, String, String)

      • information

        public static android.app.AlertDialog information(android.content.Context context,
                                                  java.lang.String title,
                                                  java.lang.String message,
                                                  java.lang.String positiveButtonText)
        Creates a new information AlertDialog with the specified message and title.

        A positive button is added to the dialog if the string positiveButtonText is not null.

        Overload information(Context, String, String, String, DialogInterface.OnClickListener). Uses a default listener which do nothing.

        Parameters:
        context - the parent context.
        title - the title of the dialog.
        message - the information message of the dialog.
        positiveButtonText - the text of the positive button if the string is non-null. Otherwise, no button is created.
        Returns:
        the created information alert dialog.
        See Also:
        information(Context, String, String, String, DialogInterface.OnClickListener), information(Context, String, String)

                                               java.lang.String title,
                                               java.lang.String message,

                                               android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener onPositiveClickListener)
        Creates a new critical error AlertDialog with the specified message and title.

        Parameters:

        title - the title of the dialog.
        message - the information message of the dialog.
        positiveButtonText - the text of the positive button if the string is non-null. Otherwise, no button is created.

        Returns:
        the created information alert dialog.
        See Also:

      • question

        public static android.app.AlertDialog question(android.content.Context context,
                                               java.lang.String title,
                                               java.lang.String message,
                                               java.lang.String yesText,
                                               java.lang.String noText,
                                               MessageBox.ResponseListener responseListener)
        Creates a new modal question dialog with the specified message and title.

        If the specified text for the positive and the negative button are null the default text is used ("yes" and "no" for the default locale). Please note that certain languages are not available. To handle other language, use the yesText and noeText parameters to use your custom locales.

        Parameters:
        context - the parent context.
        title - the title of the dialog.
        message - the information message of the dialog.
        yesText - the text used for the positive button (yes).
        noText - the text used for the negative button (no).
        responseListener - the listener handling the question response.
        Returns:
        the created question alert dialog.
        See Also:
        question(Context, String, String, ResponseListener)

      • question

        public static android.app.AlertDialog question(android.content.Context context,
                                               java.lang.String title,
                                               java.lang.String message,
                                               MessageBox.ResponseListener responseListener)
        Creates a new modal question dialog with the specified message and title.

        The positive and the negative buttons use the library localization. Please note that certain languages are not available. To handle other language, consider using question(Context, String, String, String, String, ResponseListener).

        Parameters:
        context - the parent context.
        title - the title of the dialog.
        message - the information message of the dialog.
        responseListener - the listener handling the question response.
        Returns:
        the created question alert dialog.
        See Also:
        question(Context, String, String, String, String, ResponseListener)

      • defaultOnClickListener

        private static android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener defaultOnClickListener()
        Returns:
        the a default listener which do nothing.
